content: Revenue increased more than 3% in the second quarter to $211.9 million, driven by product revenue growth of more than 10%, which was partially offset by a decline of less than 3% in the service revenue attributable to service provider consolidation and legacy product line atrophy compared with the same period last fiscal year. On a year-over-year -- on a year-to-date basis, for the 6 months of fiscal year 2022, revenue increased more than 3% to $402.2 million, driven by product revenue growth of more than 12%, which was partially offset by a decline of 3% in service revenue for the same reasons previously mentioned for the quarter.
